title: OpenType Code Snippets?
content:
Anybody have any viable resources or links where I might find a wide array of OT code snippets (for use in FontLab)? Help would be much appreciated. Thanks!

 [‹ FontExpert 2006 8.0 from Proxima for Windows - with auto-activation for InDesign CS2](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907050226/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27628 "Go to previous forum topic") [Hanging polytonic accents ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907050226/http:/www.typophile.com/node/34728 "Go to next forum topic")
author: liquisoft

comments.content:
The best thing would be to study what Adobe and MS are doing with latest fonts, and read Adobe’s [Feature File Syntax](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907050226/http:/www.adobe.com/devnet/opentype/afdko/topic_feature_file_syntax.html) document which describes the syntax as used in FLS5 or FM.  
I suggest that you also download Adobe’s [example roman fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907050226/http:/www.adobe.com/devnet/opentype/afdko/) (in the smaller box there is a link “ExampleRomanFonts.zip”) and have a close look at the files with “feature” in the name; these are very up-to-date models and cover almost all features currently supported in applications.  
In the end, you have to tailor features so they match your fonts’ glyph sets and glyph names anyway.

I think I would not recommend the old fonts as examples any more. Adobe has changed a few things, as described in Thomas Phinneys [Facelift](http://web.archive.org/web/20080907050226/http:/blogs.adobe.com/typblography/typotechnica2007/Facelift.pdf) presentation. The sample font provided alongside the AFDKO represents current best practice.
